docs.snippet: BUENOS AIRES, Dec. 15. -- Consideration of proposals for the establishment of an inter-American court of justice was postponed until the Pan-American conference to be held at Lima, Peru, in 1938. This was a result of a resolution adopted today by the...
docs.lead_paragraph: BUENOS AIRES, Dec. 15. -- Consideration of proposals for the establishment of an inter-American court of justice was postponed until the Pan-American conference to be held at Lima, Peru, in 1938. This was a result of a resolution adopted today by the first standing committee of the Inter-American Conference for the Maintenance of Peace.
docs.abstract: Min Saavedra Lamas, at Inter-Amer Conf for maintenance of Peace com meeting, opposes any attempt to set up Pan-Amer code

headline.main: AMERICAS' COURT PUT OFF BY PARLEY; Proposals for Justice Tribunal for This Hemisphere Are Sidetracked Till 1938. TO BE STUDIED MEANWHILE Buenos Aires Committee Backs Plan to Make Some Pacts Open to the World.

keywords.value: PAN-AMER PEACE CONF (INTER-AMER CONF FOR THE MAINTENANCE OF PEACE)

byline.original: By JOHN W. WHITESpecial Cable to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: BUENOS AIRES, Dec. 15. -- The neutrality convention was finally agreed upon today for introduction in the Inter-American Conference for the Maintenance of Peace, with the unanimous backing of the twenty-one delegations taking part. Thus untroubled...
docs.lead_paragraph: BUENOS AIRES, Dec. 15. -- The neutrality convention was finally agreed upon today for introduction in the Inter-American Conference for the Maintenance of Peace, with the unanimous backing of the twenty-one delegations taking part. Thus untroubled passage of this convention, like the collective security and non-intervention agreements, is assured at tomorrow's plenary session.
docs.abstract: draft of neutrality pact agreed on in com; outline; reservations by Argentina, Salvador and Colombia

headline.main: NEUTRALITY PACT READY AT PARLEY; Draft Agreed on in Committee at Buenos Aires Bars Any Conflict With League. CONSULTATION IS RETAINED Hull Gratified at Unanimity -- Quick Passage by Peace Conference Forecast.

byline.original: By HAROLD B. HINTONSpecial Cable to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: Continued strength in some South American dollar loans and secondary domestic corporate issues again characterized trading in bonds yesterday on the New York Stock Exchange. The trading pace was stepped up considerably, transactions amounting to...
docs.lead_paragraph: Continued strength in some South American dollar loans and secondary domestic corporate issues again characterized trading in bonds yesterday on the New York Stock Exchange. The trading pace was stepped up considerably, transactions amounting to $17,299,900, compared to $13,503,800 on Monday.

headline.main: FEDERAL BONDS SAG IN QUIET TRADING; Some South American Dollar Loans and Secondary Rails Show Strength.

docs.snippet: Selected South American dollar obligations stood out as the only major group to exhibit underlying strength in bond trading yesterday on the New York Stock Exchange. Domestic loans, including both the higher grade investments as well as the secondary...
docs.lead_paragraph: Selected South American dollar obligations stood out as the only major group to exhibit underlying strength in bond trading yesterday on the New York Stock Exchange. Domestic loans, including both the higher grade investments as well as the secondary issues, were subjected to varying degrees of selling pressure and drifted irregularly to moderately lower levels.

headline.main: ACTIVITY IN BONDS OF SOUTH AMERICA; Dollar Obligations Only Major Group Showing Underlying Strength in Trading. URUGUAY ISSUES IN LEAD United States Securities Drift Lower, Except for the New Treasury 2 1/2s.

docs.snippet: Latin-American nations, with few exceptions, are emerging from the exchange difficulties which have handicapped their foreign trade for several years and 1937 should bring a substantial expansion in orders from that continent, export credit men...
docs.lead_paragraph: Latin-American nations, with few exceptions, are emerging from the exchange difficulties which have handicapped their foreign trade for several years and 1937 should bring a substantial expansion in orders from that continent, export credit men agreed yesterday.

headline.main: CONDITIONS BETTER IN LATIN AMERICA; Export Credit Men Report the Exchange Difficulties Are Being Ironed Out. EXPANSION IN 1937 SEEN Bills Are Being Met With More Promptness and U.S. Concerns Are Increasing Business.

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Dec. 16. -- All but ten of this country's fifty principal foreign markets purchased in October more goods made in the United States than in the corresponding month last year and shipments were larger to all the seven so-called grand...
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Dec. 16. -- All but ten of this country's fifty principal foreign markets purchased in October more goods made in the United States than in the corresponding month last year and shipments were larger to all the seven so-called grand divisions, the Department of Commerce reported today in its analysis of trade by countries.

headline.main: EXPORT MARKETS TAKE MORE GOODS; Shipments From United States in October Show Increase Over Year Before. IMPORTS ALSO GO UPWARD United Kingdom Continues as Best Customer -- Canada and Japan Next.

byline.original: Special to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: BUENOS AIRES, Dec. 17. -- The Inter-American Conference for the Maintenance of Peace devoted its principal efforts today to providing for a vast interchange of intellectual and cultural values among the American nations as a foundation on which to...
docs.lead_paragraph: BUENOS AIRES, Dec. 17. -- The Inter-American Conference for the Maintenance of Peace devoted its principal efforts today to providing for a vast interchange of intellectual and cultural values among the American nations as a foundation on which to build permanent peace.
docs.abstract: Pan-Amer peace conf adopts suggestion for inter-Amer exhibition of fine and applied arts in 1940

headline.main: AMERICAS EVOLVE CULTURAL PROGRAM; Hull's Plan for Exchange of Students and Professors Is Accepted by Committee. ART EXPOSITION PLANNED Proposal for a League of the 21 Republics Is Shelved for the Time Being.

byline.original: By JOHN W. WHITESpecial Cable to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: GENEVA, Dec. 18. -- The League of Nations reform committee adjourned indefinitely yesterday after naming eleven rapporteurs to prepare the next stage of its work on the proposals it has decided to treat first. Chairman M. Bourquin, authorized to...
docs.lead_paragraph: GENEVA, Dec. 18. -- The League of Nations reform committee adjourned indefinitely yesterday after naming eleven rapporteurs to prepare the next stage of its work on the proposals it has decided to treat first. Chairman M. Bourquin, authorized to convoke it when he believed a meeting necessary, is expected to call a session in several weeks.

headline.main: LEAGUE REFORM HELD UNLIKELY AT PRESENT; Committee Adjourns After Naming Rapporteurs to Prepare the Next Stage.

byline.original: Wireless to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: BUENOS AIRES, Dec. 18. -- Definite peace in the Chaco has become the new goal of the Inter-American Conference for the Maintenance of Peace, in session here. Secret negotiations have been progressing all this week in an attempt to persuade Bolivia...
docs.lead_paragraph: BUENOS AIRES, Dec. 18. -- Definite peace in the Chaco has become the new goal of the Inter-American Conference for the Maintenance of Peace, in session here. Secret negotiations have been progressing all this week in an attempt to persuade Bolivia and Paraguay to renew diplomatic relations and begin conversations toward a settlement of the frontier problem that underlies the entire Chaco problem.
docs.abstract: Pan-Amer peace conf secret negotiations for peace

headline.main: PEACE IN THE CHACO NEW AIM OF PARLEY; Conference at Buenos Aires Strives to Bring Paraguay and Bolivia to Terms.

docs.snippet: BUENOS AIRES, Dec. 19. -- The Inter-American Conference for the Maintenance of Peace met in a long plenary session this afternoon and laid the third of four foundation stones for its new structure for permanent peace, by adopting a neutrality...
docs.lead_paragraph: BUENOS AIRES, Dec. 19. -- The Inter-American Conference for the Maintenance of Peace met in a long plenary session this afternoon and laid the third of four foundation stones for its new structure for permanent peace, by adopting a neutrality convention that obligates all the American countries to take a common joint attitude as neutrals in case of an outbreak of hostilities between any two of them.
docs.abstract: Pan-Amer peace conf passes resolution urging govts to ban films that disturb friendly relations between countries

headline.main: AMERICAS ADOPT NEUTRALITY PACT; 21 Nations Pledge a Joint Attitude in Case of Clash Between Any Two. SOLIDARITY ACCORD NEXT Due to Be Adopted Tomorrow -- Te Deum in Buenos Aires Marks Parley's Success.
